    • Uses of SphericalCoordinates in ca.eandb.jmist.math

      Fields in ca.eandb.jmist.math declared as SphericalCoordinates 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      static SphericalCoordinates SphericalCoordinates.ANTINORMAL
      The SphericalCoordinates for the direction opposite to the normal direction (i.e., the polar angle is PI, the azimuthal angle is zero, and the radius is 1.0).
      static SphericalCoordinates SphericalCoordinates.NORMAL
      The SphericalCoordinates for the normal direction (i.e., the polar and azimuthal angles are both zero, the radius is 1.0).
      Methods in ca.eandb.jmist.math that return SphericalCoordinates 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      SphericalCoordinates SphericalCoordinates.canonical()
      Computes the canonical form of this vector.
      static SphericalCoordinates SphericalCoordinates.canonical(double polar, double azimuthal)
      Computes the canonical form of the vector with the given polar and azimuthal angles and unit radius.
      static SphericalCoordinates SphericalCoordinates.canonical(double polar, double azimuthal, double radius)
      Computes the canonical form of the vector with the given polar and azimuthal angles and the given radius.
      static SphericalCoordinates SphericalCoordinates.fromCartesian(Vector3 v)
      Converts a vector from cartesian coordinates to SphericalCoordinates.
      static SphericalCoordinates SphericalCoordinates.fromCartesian(Vector3 v, Basis3 basis)
      Converts a vector from cartesian coordinates to SphericalCoordinates.
      static SphericalCoordinates SphericalCoordinates.fromCompactDirection(short dir)
      Creates a SphericalCoordinates corresponding to the provided two byte direction representation.
      SphericalCoordinates SphericalCoordinates.opposite()
      Returns the vector of the same length as this vector in the opposite direction.
      SphericalCoordinates SphericalCoordinates.times(double factor)
      Scales this vector by a constant factor.
      SphericalCoordinates SphericalCoordinates.unit()
      Returns the vector of unit length in the same direction as this vector.
